org.digijava.module.help.lucene

Class LucHelpModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digijava.module.help.lucene.LucHelpModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, LucModule<HelpTopicHelper>

    public class LucHelpModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements LucModule<HelpTopicHelper>
    Lucene module for Help topics
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LucHelpModule()
      Creates lucene module for help of English and all unsupported languages.
      LucHelpModule(java.lang.String moduleInstance)
      Creates lucene module for help for specified module instance Languages will be English and all unsupported languages.
      LucHelpModule(java.lang.String moduleInstance, LangSupport lang)
      Creates lucene module for help for specified supported language and module instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LucHelpModule

        public LucHelpModule()
        Creates lucene module for help of English and all unsupported languages. This means that all unsupported languages will be indexed together with English.
        See Also:
        LangSupport

      • getIdFieldTerm

        public org.apache.lucene.index.Term getIdFieldTerm(HelpTopicHelper item)
        Description copied from interface: LucModule
        Get term for ID field to search one single doc. Module should create term by using field name as first parameter in term constructor and value of that field retrieved from item as second parameters TODO need refactoring: probably it is better to get ID value from module and build Term object in LuceneWorker?
        Specified by:
